questions.text: On which date did the Constitution of India come into effect?
questions.explanation:
The Constitution of India came into effect on 26th January 1950, which is celebrated as Republic Day.

Important dates related to the Constitution:
- 9 December 1946: First meeting of Constituent Assembly
- 26 November 1949: Constitution was adopted
- 26 January 1950: Constitution came into effect (Republic Day)

January 26 was chosen to commemorate the declaration of 'Purna Swaraj' (Complete Independence) by the Indian National Congress in 1930.

questions.text: How many Fundamental Rights are currently guaranteed by the Indian Constitution?
questions.explanation:
There are currently Six Fundamental Rights guaranteed by the Indian Constitution.

Originally, there were Seven Fundamental Rights:
1. Right to Equality
2. Right to Freedom
3. Right against Exploitation
4. Right to Freedom of Religion
5. Cultural and Educational Rights
6. Right to Property
7. Right to Constitutional Remedies

However, the Right to Property was removed from the list of Fundamental Rights by the 44th Amendment Act, 1978. It is now a legal right under Article 300A.

Therefore, currently there are Six Fundamental Rights.

questions.text: Who is known as the 'Father of the Indian Constitution'?
questions.explanation:
Dr. B.R. Ambedkar is known as the 'Father of the Indian Constitution'.

He was the Chairman of the Drafting Committee of the Constituent Assembly and played a pivotal role in drafting the Constitution of India. His deep knowledge of constitutional law and commitment to social justice greatly influenced the Constitution.

Other important roles:
- Dr. Rajendra Prasad: President of the Constituent Assembly
- Jawaharlal Nehru: Moved the Objectives Resolution which formed the basis of the Preamble
- Mahatma Gandhi: Though not a member, his philosophy greatly influenced the Constitution

Dr. Ambedkar also called Article 32 (Right to Constitutional Remedies) as the 'Heart and Soul' of the Constitution.
